column5: Spent Candada Day week up at Memquisit Lodge with Mr. Mike, Grew, one lurking buddy and a non-member.  We were mostly targeting Musky & Bass, with the occasional walleye for dinner. The musky were hard to find, we didnt even get a follow. We might need to bring Lew along next time to show us the spots.  Caught some smaller pike on musky baits, but thats about it.  On to the pics, all taken with cellphones, but most turned out ok  Groceries for the trip. Lots of looks and nosey people at No frills lol    Heres our cabin up at Memquisit, we got the biggest one they had, plenty of room for 6 guys, although we did have to bring up 300ft of extension cords to charge the batteries for the front mounts at night    Bass were on fire in the evening, decent in the morning, and pretty much dead mid-day Most of these bass pics are in the evening          Morning Smallie that took a nice hit from something big       More Evening bass, Some double header action too.                     And some more bass                   Mr. Mike with a trophy     Goose with some nice bass & sheepshead           Sliver pike, caught trolling      some scenery & misc. pics (some of my new wallpapers)                              some panoramic shots i took on my phone
awesome stuff !!!! looks like a good time ...
Great stuff.  Gotta love those largies!
Nice bass! Cool looking pike! and amazing panos! Great trip!
Wow.  Tons of bass.  Great report man!

thanks!  yeah definitely a ton of bass.  I even left out a bunch of pics, and there were a bunch of little guys we didnt even bother taking pics of. Some nights we would catch 20-30 bass between us in just a couple hrs. usually from about 6pm-9pm
Great report!  It makes me want to head out there ASAP.  I have never targeted large mouth in the west arm before but I'm thinking I should try...
you have enough bass there to fill up a 50lbs musky!
Nice bass guys!!! Next time you go up let me know by PM and I will email you maps of the west arm with muskies spots.
That is some fiiiiiine bass action!  Nicely done boys    That lodge looks like a great little spot too....would you go back?
i would go back for sure, maybe at a later time of year though. It was hot as hell!  we shouldve brought up some fans for the cabin.
Thats some great bass,n guys. Well done.

Really good report Boss. You got enough bass too! Those pads look like surface bait heaven. Memquisit is a nice place. I've never stayed there but I've fished near it often and have heard very good reports about the place. It's for sale (along with a bunch of other places) if anyone is interested. It wouldn't take much to put me over the investor's line.
those are some nice bass you got there Boss. looks like a good time
Great report and it looks like ya had a great time with the bass fishing.  The silver pike are interesting - caught one myself a couple years back.   Love the panoramic shots - really great.
Looks like a great week thanks for sharing
Great pics, some nice Bass! Thanks for sharing!
I've been to that place twice too, very nice
Seems you were in Bass heaven...
Great report, looks like a blast! Never even heard of a silver pike before, cool to see.

I'll be back at Lakair in a few weeks boss, c'mon up and we'll go see what we can find  You guys had a fantastic week with some amazing fish from the looks of things and that sure does make for a great vacation.
Hey Boss  I will be on the South Shore near the end of Aug. I will be running around and will make a trip over to the French!  Thanks for the info  Rick
Wow excellent mix bag of fish boys.Some great sunset pics as well.  Beautiful!!!!!!!!!!!!
